info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 8:33PM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Flathead County through 915 PM MDT... At 831 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles north of West Glacier, or 33 miles north of Evergreen, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Visibility one-half mile or less and winds in excess of 30 mph. This storm is producing very heavy rainfall...up to 8 tenths of an inch in 30 minutes. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Low visibility could result in dangerous driving conditions. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Lake McDonald, Avalanche Creek Campground and Sprague Creek Campground. This includes Highway 2 between mile markers 155 and 161. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until this storm passes.
